p: Foaming capacity (FC) and stability (FS) were determined in triplicate as whip-ability of flour dispersed in water according to Coffmann and Garciaj [ 27]. Flour (5 g) was dispersed in 100 ml of deionised water and blended for 5 min using a Waring Laboratory blender at high speed. The blended mixture was poured into a 250 ml graduated cylinder and total height and height of the emulsion layer were measured immediately and after 1, 2, 4 and 6 h of room temperature incubation. FC and FS were calculated according to Eltayeb, Ali [ 29].
